Habitat: Aloe vera is native to the Arabian Peninsula but is now cultivated in various tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
It thrives in arid, dry climates and is commonly found in regions such as North Africa, Southern Europe, India, and the Americas

Ayurveda: Enhances skin health by soothing burns, cuts, and abrasions
Improves digestive health by alleviating constipation and improving gut flora
Yoga_Naturopathy: Used to promote hydration and healing of the skin
Applied as a cooling agent to reduce inflammation and irritation
Unani: Used to treat skin disorders and burns due to its cooling and soothing effects
Applied to wounds and ulcers for faster healing
Siddha: Treats various skin conditions and infections due to its antimicrobial properties
Used in formulations to alleviate digestive problems and improve appetite
Homeopathy: Used for treating skin irritations, burns, and abrasions with its soothing properties
Administered to relieve digestive disturbances such as constipation and bloating

data.history: Aloe Vera, known as 'Ghritkumari' in Ayurveda, has been used for thousands of years for its cooling and healing properties.

Soil_requirements: Prefers well-drained, sandy or loamy soil
Soil pH should be between 6.0 and 7.0
Climate: Thrives in warm climates with temperatures ranging from 20°C to 30°C
Requires minimal rainfall and can tolerate dry conditions
Planting: Space plants about 30-45 cm apart to accommodate growth

Habitat: Same habitat description as Aloe vera
